timeline.description:
Little Kindred Influence

Truly the wilds, home to the Garou and the Fae, the Blue Ridge was avoided by all but the most brave Kindred. The railroads further north or south provided safer travel and protection to those who dwell in the night seeking passage West.

1888 - Kindred Involvement accelerates

George Vanderbilt decides to begin purchasing his 12,500 acre estate, assisting both Pentex and vampires who each seek to gain a foothold in the Land of the Sky. The Ventrue Elder Evander uses this opportunity to settle in the region and benefit from the wealth being generated and make his mark on the nascent expansion of the region.

Evander's youngest childe, E. W. Grove, famously betrays his sire to the Sabbat and the domain falls. Evander is destroyed, and Tallula Donegan declares Asheville won for the Sword of Caine. She receives the bloodbath and ascends to Archbishop of Southern Appalachia.

The Treaty of the Land of the Sky returns the domain to the Camarilla For reasons that remain mysterious, Archbishop Tallula renounces the Sabbat and becomes the domain's Prince as part of the Camarilla. Many Sabbat rise against her, meeting their final death that fateful October night. Outlying towns such as Black Mountain and Waynesville remain home to Sabbat packs to this day. This treaty is overseen by the domain's new Tremere liaison Elder Volshebnik who, despite threats of diablerie, proves to be here to stay. The Basilica of St. Lawrence is established as an Elysium.
Influence of the Southern Lords grows.
Union forces capture Atlanta (September 1, 1864). Post-Civil War: Ventrue and allies (incl. Gen. Johnston) claim domain. Justicar Ignatus retakes city.
Sabbat Crusade conquers Atlanta, settled into Sabbat control as capital of the South.
Post-Civil War period - Camarilla influence established.
Taken over by Swift, a Sabbat Gangrel.
Camarilla influence established on the coast, spreads inland.
Camarilla pushes back, Sabbat has upper hand, contested.
Post-Civil War period - Camarilla influence established.
Falls under Sabbat influence spreading north from Mexico.
Post-Civil War period - Camarilla influence established.
New Malkavian Prince takes control after coup (sect unclear initially).
Retaken by Camarilla, now target for Sabbat siege.
Post-Civil War period - Camarilla influence established.
Early Sabbat entrenchment in Spanish colonies.
Early Camarilla influence from the coast.
Union forces capture Charleston (February 18, 1865). Post-Civil War: Camarilla control established.
Fell to Sabbat Crusade, later settled into Sabbat control.
Part of the Appalachian Anarch range.
Influence of the Southern Lords grows.
Post-Civil War period - Camarilla influence established, Held by Prince Ginevra Bellecourt.
Fell to Sabbat Crusade, Bellecourt never disbanded or left the city, ruling a Prince from the resistance underground.
Camarilla pushes back, and Prince Ginevra Bellecourt succeeds in recovering her Praxis.
Part of the Appalachian Anarch range.
Union forces sack Columbia (February 17, 1865). Post-Civil War period - Camarilla influence established.
Contested on the Texas border, after Crusade push back from the Camarilla

Status Unknown (Listed in Notable Domains table), likely contested.
Part of the Appalachian Anarch range.

Officially taken by the Independent Alliance.

Early Colonial Era - Status Unknown. European Kindred begin claiming unseen domains.
Doran defeated by Natchez tribe, domain lost.

Doran regains power after a revolt. Area contested.

Ostensibly Camarilla with Prince Antonio Calbullarshi, true power with Vodouists alliance.
